greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of inequivalent n X k binary matrices, where equivalence means permutations of rows or columns or the symbol set; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..35, flattened
maple: g:= proc(n, k) option remember; add(add(add(mul(mul(add(d*
coeff(u, x, d), d=divisors(ilcm(i, j)))^(igcd(i, j)*
coeff(s, x, i)*coeff(t, x, j)), j=1..degree(t)),
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, {0}, If[i < 1, {}, Flatten[Table[Map[ Function[p, p + j*x^i], b[n - i*j, i - 1]], {j, 0, n/i}]]]];

g[n_, k_] := g[n, k] = Sum[Sum[Sum[Product[Product[With[{gc = GCD[i, j]* Coefficient[s, x, i]*Coefficient[t, x, j]}, If[gc == 0, 1, Sum[d* Coefficient[u, x, d], {d, Divisors[LCM[i, j]]}]^gc]], {j, 1, Exponent[t, x]}],
{i, Exponent[s, x]}]/Product[i^Coefficient[u, x, i]*Coefficient[u, x, i]!,
{i, Exponent[u, x]}]/Product[i^Coefficient[t, x, i]*Coefficient[t, x, i]!,
{i, Exponent[t, x]}]/Product[i^Coefficient[s, x, i]*Coefficient[s, x, i]!,
Table[Table[A[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 25 2016, adapted from Maple, updated Jan 01 2021 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 14 2014
